thread.title: French firm chases rail deals in Saudi Arabia, UAE, Qatar | Local
thread.title_full: French firm chases rail deals in Saudi Arabia, UAE, Qatar | Local | News | Qatar Day

author: Arabian Business
title: French firm chases rail deals in Saudi Arabia, UAE, Qatar | Local
text:
A unit of the French state railway firm SNCF is reportedly bidding to operate subways and light rail services which are currently being set up in the Gulf region.
Keolis is looking at pursuing contracts in Saudi Arabia, Qatar and the UAE, the French company’s first foray into the Middle East, Bloomberg reported.
It said Jean-Pierre Farandou, executive chairman of Keolis, has met senior executives from Dubai’s Road and Transport Authority and Abu Dhabi’s Department of Transport.
Farandou declined to identify countries where Keolis has submitted preliminary offers, Bloomberg reported.
 Gulf countries are developing metro lines domestically as well as passenger-train lines to connect the six Gulf Cooperation Council nations, prompting Keolis to be bullish on the Middle East.
It sees “tremendous opportunities” and successful bids may generate annual turnover of $100 million in five years, Farandou was Quote: d as saying, adding that he hopes to hear back on some of the tenders by the beginning of next year.
Entry into the Gulf markets would be a "big game-changer" for the company, Farandou told Bloomberg, saying that in 10 years, the Middle East could be one of its major revenue zones.
